hive_lesson.title: 08 Sentence Patterns
hive_lesson.description: Two people discuss their daily routines.

hive_text_custom.text: : So Natalie, what is a typical day for you? For example, what is a typical morning?
: Well, I wake up at about 7.00 a.m.
: Yes, I really am a morning person.
: I think you are a morning person. I'm not a morning person at all.
: Well, I don't actually get out of bed until about 7.30.
: Okay, so what do you do?
: Well, I play on my phone, I check my emails, I check Facebook, and I read the news.
: Do you eat breakfast at home?
: I usually prepare breakfast at home, yeah.
: Oh, just the simple stuff, eggs, bacon, sausages, sometimes I'll have toast.
: Do you drink coffee or tea?
: No, I don't like coffee or tea.
: Actually, I like hot chocolate in the morning.
: Yeah, I like hot chocolate too. So what about your day?
: Well, I'm a teacher. I teach at a school. Lessons start at about 9.00 a.m. and we have lunch at noon.
: How many classes do you have in the morning?
: Each class lasts an hour, so I have three classes.
: Do you eat lunch at school?
: Yes, we have a huge canteen.
: The food is great and it's so much fun eating with the students too.
: Is the food cheap or expensive?
: It's pretty cheap. I'd say maybe $3 for lunch.
: Yeah, and for that you get a lot of food.
: What do you do in the afternoon?
: In the afternoon I have more lessons, usually taking me till about 4.00 p.m.
: Oh and do you have big classes?
: Yes, so I teach English, that means I teach the whole year, so I have really big classes. We have about 200 students at the school.
: What about the evening? What do you do in the evening?

: When I get home I'm usually really tired, so I get changed into my pajamas and I watch TV for about two hours. After that, I'll maybe have some dinner, maybe get a pizza and then read a book or play on my phone again.
: What do you watch on TV?
: I really like watching Korean drama.
: I know, the characters are so much fun.
: A little bit but I think it's a little bit boring. I prefer American pop.
: Oh so you like Korean dramas and American music?
: That's right. I also like game shows.
: Well actually my favorite one is Busted, and that's also Korean.
: Okay, I need to see that. So when do you go to bed?
: Most nights I go to bed at around 10.00 p.m. but at the weekend, sometimes it's later, maybe around midnight.
: Well I think you have an interesting and long day.
: That's right, I'm usually very tired.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1) When does she get out of bed?
2) What does she do in the morning in bed?
3) What does she like to eat in the morning?
4) What does she drink in the morning?
5) What does she do in the evening?

hive_grammar.point: Point 1: A common sentence pattern in Engish is S.V.O which means sbject, verb, object.

hive_text_custom.text: My town has a big park.
They play tennis once a week.

hive_grammar.point: Point 2: WH questions usually follow this pattern: WH + Auxiliary + S + O + ?

hive_text_custom.text: What do you do at your job?
Where did you buy that shirt?

hive_grammar.point: Point 3: Yes / No questions use the same pattern withouth the WH word: Auxiliary + S + O + ?

hive_text_custom.text: Do you get much snow in your town?

hive_grammar.point: Point 4: Yes / No questions often have short form answers.
